DefaultEvent.Description: A tranquil hour gathering the lumpy, sweet-tasting stuff from the trees and refilling your water casks. Best mark the spot.
DefaultEvent.Name: Gall-fruits and fresh water

ChildBranches.Name: Resupply, but keep away from the stream
ChildBranches.Description: Trees rarely attack. Fish, as any zailor knows, are chancier.

SuccessEvent.Description: You return to the ship with gall-fruit, gloam-carp and freshly filled water-casks. This has been a good day.
SuccessEvent.Name: Well-laden

DefaultEvent.Description: The strangling horror that emerges from the water is - you learn later - four feet eight inches in length. Consequently it falls short of the five feet six inches which would qualify it as a monstrosity under Department of Menace Eradication guidelines. This is little comfort to the screaming seaman in whom it embeds its many mouths. You extinguish its horrid life with a flurry of gaff-hooks, but too late for him...
DefaultEvent.Name: Almost a monster

ChildBranches.Name: Fish in the stream
ChildBranches.Description: Now and again, lazy, menacing ripples disturb the surface. There's more in there than sticklebacks.

Description: A quiet hollow. A stream of sweet dark water. A grove of parasynthetic fruit trees, boughs heavy with symbiotic fungus.
Name: An Oasis of Sorts
